issue.title: Sonarcloud Code Analysis
issue.body:
**Describe your proposal**
Setting up Sonarcloud Code Analysis could help improve code quality

I've set it up for my fork and these are the results:
https://sonarcloud.io/summary/overall?id=Alexander-Wilms_vcmi

It tries to detect possible bugs, code smells and security issues:

![image](https://github.com/vcmi/vcmi/assets/3226457/44e5678e-5f69-4016-b27d-e11f1a5e5771)


**Additional context**

issue.title: Crash on high scores screen
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Adding more high scores with same player name leads to crash.

**Game logs**

Call stack:
```
 	KernelBase.dll!00007fff5d664ffc()	No info
 	vcruntime140.dll!00007fff2c5d6720()	No info
>	VCMI_lib.dll!std::_Throw_bad_variant_access() Line 418	C++
 	VCMI_lib.dll!std::get(const std::variant<std::monostate,bool,double,std::string,std::vector<JsonNode,std::allocator<JsonNode>>,std::map<std::string,JsonNode,std::less<std::string>,std::allocator<std::pair<std::string const ,JsonNode>>>,__int64> &) Line 1225	C++
 	VCMI_lib.dll!std::get(const std::variant<std::monostate,bool,double,std::string,std::vector<JsonNode,std::allocator<JsonNode>>,std::map<std::string,JsonNode,std::less<std::string>,std::allocator<std::pair<std::string const ,JsonNode>>>,__int64> &) Line 1260	C++
 	VCMI_lib.dll!JsonNode::Integer() Line 342	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CHighScoreInputScreen::addEntry::__l2::<lambda>(const JsonNode & left, const JsonNode & right) Line 256	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!std::sort(const std::_Vector_iterator<std::_Vector_val<std::_Simple_types<JsonNode>>>) Line 8067	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!boost::range::sort(std::vector<JsonNode,std::allocator<JsonNode>> &) Line 51	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CHighScoreInputScreen::addEntry(std::string text) Line 274	C++
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_client.exe!std::_Func_class<void,std::string>::operator()(std::string) Line 883	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CHighScoreInput::okay() Line 383	C++
```

**To Reproduce**
1. Win a game
2. Put your name in the high scores
3. Win another game
4. Put same name in high scores

**Expected behavior**
No crash

**Actual behavior**
`JsonNode::Intege`r throws `bad_variant_access`.

**Did it work earlier?**
 Nope, it's a new feature.

**Screenshots**
Crash occurs before high scores are displayed.

**Version**
1.4.0

comment.body: @Laserlicht you may want to check this

issue.title: RMG: Object placement Issues
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Some weird object placements. Mainly WoG plus HotA (do not remember in what order).
If those are suspected to come from bad mod graphics... discard them for the moment.

1) Those 2 buildings too close for comfort
2) Stone Arch hide building
3) same stone arch
4) Centaur sits on resources
5) nightmare hides behind bushes
6) Naga sits on resources

![image](https://github.com/vcmi/vcmi/assets/15194321/cbb53bf6-7407-446c-ba85-10ce4a886992)

Edit: Added a new batch in comments

comment.body:
![image](https://github.com/vcmi/vcmi/assets/2566990/f6d917e3-d56d-4fec-8c48-aed21672da8a)
This is actually in-line with object mask definition. Just def from mod doesn't quite match the original.

issue.title: Crash on high scores screen
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Adding more high scores with same player name leads to crash.

**Game logs**
```
 	KernelBase.dll!00007fff5d664ffc()	Brak informacji
 	vcruntime140.dll!00007fff2c5d6720()	Brak informacji
>	VCMI_lib.dll!std::_Throw_bad_variant_access() Wiersz 418	C++
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_lib.dll!std::get(const std::variant<std::monostate,bool,double,std::string,std::vector<JsonNode,std::allocator<JsonNode>>,std::map<std::string,JsonNode,std::less<std::string>,std::allocator<std::pair<std::string const ,JsonNode>>>,__int64> &) Wiersz 1225	C++
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_lib.dll!std::get(const std::variant<std::monostate,bool,double,std::string,std::vector<JsonNode,std::allocator<JsonNode>>,std::map<std::string,JsonNode,std::less<std::string>,std::allocator<std::pair<std::string const ,JsonNode>>>,__int64> &) Wiersz 1260	C++
 	VCMI_lib.dll!JsonNode::Integer() Wiersz 342	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CHighScoreInputScreen::addEntry::__l2::<lambda>(const JsonNode & left, const JsonNode & right) Wiersz 256	C++
 	[Kod zewnętrzny]	
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_client.exe!std::sort(const std::_Vector_iterator<std::_Vector_val<std::_Simple_types<JsonNode>>>) Wiersz 8067	C++
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_client.exe!boost::range::sort(std::vector<JsonNode,std::allocator<JsonNode>> &) Wiersz 51	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CHighScoreInputScreen::addEntry(std::string text) Wiersz 274	C++
 	[Kod zewnętrzny]	
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_client.exe!std::_Func_class<void,std::string>::operator()(std::string) Wiersz 883	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CHighScoreInput::okay() Wiersz 383	C++
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_client.exe!std::_Func_class<void>::operator()() Wiersz 883	C++
 	[Ramka wbudowana] VCMI_client.exe!CFunctionList<void __cdecl(void)>::operator()() Wiersz 62	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CButton::onButtonClicked() Wiersz 164	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CButton::clickReleased(const Point & cursorPosition) Wiersz 198	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!EventDispatcher::handleLeftButtonClick(const Point & position, int tolerance, bool isPressed) Wiersz 221	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!InputSourceMouse::handleEventMouseButtonUp(const SDL_MouseButtonEvent & button) Wiersz 86	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!InputHandler::processEvents() Wiersz 88	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CGuiHandler::handleEvents() Wiersz 93	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CMainMenu::update() Wiersz 345	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!CGuiHandler::renderFrame() Wiersz 118	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!mainLoop() Wiersz 451	C++
 	VCMI_client.exe!wmain(int argc, wchar_t * * argv) Wiersz 412	C++
```

**To Reproduce**
1. Win a game
2. Put your name in the high scores
3. Win another game
4. Put same name in high scores

**Expected behavior**
No crash

**Actual behavior**
`JsonNode::Intege`r throws `bad_variant_access`.

**Did it work earlier?**
 Nope, it's a new feature.

**Screenshots**
Crash occurs before high scores are displayed.

**Version**
1.4.0

issue.title: Antivirus alert
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The antivirus issues a warning if you scan the release VCMI-1.3.2-Windows.exe or zip.
Virtotal scan results https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/f7e59a542dc09d1c85db19714e1c6a1693881ba8f9545f7c05f9d5c732e3db1d/detection
https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/4168ed04e01e4dd50256001bf6c4ee5ed41073821cc4cdce20d76e3f34635633

**Game logs**
The problem occurs before installation or startup.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://github.com/vcmi/vcmi/releases/tag/1.3.2
2. Download VCMI-1.3.2-Windows.exe or VCMI-1.3.2-Windows.zip
3. Go to https://www.virustotal.com/
4. Upload VCMI-1.3.2-Windows.exe or VCMI-1.3.2-Windows.zip file
5. Check scanning result

**Expected behavior**
Scanning resullt: No security vendors and no sandboxes flagged this file as malicious

**Actual behavior**
Scanning resullt: 3 security vendors and no sandboxes flagged this file as malicious

**Did it work earlier?**
1.1.1 is ok, in later versions the antivirus issues a warning

**Version**
 - OS: Windows
 - Version: 1.3.2

comment.body: No virus detected on develop builds

pull_request.title: Mod compatibility fixes
pull_request.body:
Minor fixes to avoid potential crashes if player has outdated mods:
- Do not crash if handler for map objects was not found, instead fall back onto generic (empty) handler. Discovered since I removed separate "shrine" handler (merged into "configurable"), but hota mod uses "shrine" handler in 1.3.
- Block loading of objects into another mod namespace. Side effect of "torosar " fix - mods that still edit "torosar " now attempt to create new object with mostly invalid/unset properties. With this change such attempts will be ignored.

commits.message:
Add CI stage to ensure LF line endings

Based on @josch's command:
https://github.com/vcmi/vcmi/pull/3078#issuecomment-1772150744

Change remaining CRLF line endings to LF

find . -type f -name "*.JSON" -exec dos2unix {} \+;
CI step "Ensure LF line endings": Don't create subshell for grouped commands

CI step "Ensure LF line endings": No need to ignore Android files

Co-authored-by: Ivan Savenko <saven.ivan@gmail.com>
Convert XML files in android/ from CRLF to LF, exclude .bat files from CI check

Merge pull request #3096 from Alexander-Wilms/develop

Add CI stage to ensure LF line endings

issue.title: fails to build on armel with undefined reference to `__atomic_fetch_add_8'
issue.body:
When compiling latest vcmi under Debian unstable on armel it fails with:

```
[ 65%] Linking CXX executable ../bin/vcmiserver
cd /<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/obj-arm-linux-gnueabi/server && /usr/bin/cmake -E cmake_link_script CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/link.txt --verbose=1
/usr/bin/c++ -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -Wall -Wextra -Wpointer-arith -Wuninitialized -Wmismatched-tags -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-switch -Wno-reorder -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-varargs -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/StdInc.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CGameHandler.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/HeroPoolProcessor.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/PlayerMessageProcessor.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/ServerSpellCastEnvironment.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CQuery.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CVCMIServer.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksServer.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksLobbyServer.cpp.o -o ../bin/vcmiserver  -Wl,-rpath,"\$ORIGIN::::::::::::::::::::::::" ../bin/libvcmi.so /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libminizip.so /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libz.so -ldl -lrt /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_filesystem.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_program_options.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_locale.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_thread.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_atomic.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_chrono.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_system.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_date_time.so.1.74.0 
/usr/bin/ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_fetch_add_8'
/usr/bin/ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_load_8'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[3]: *** [server/CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/build.make:273: bin/vcmiserver] Error 1
make[3]: Leaving directory '/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/obj-arm-linux-gnueabi'
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:574: server/CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/all] Error 2
```

Full log: https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=vcmi&arch=armel&ver=1.3.2%2Bdfsg-1&stamp=1698162756&raw=0

This problem can be solved by adding the `-latomic` linker flag.

comment.body:
> Looks like we need to add this only on such platforms?

The "armel" architecture is the only platform exhibiting that problem amongst the ones that we build vcmi for in Debian. Other platforms like armhf, arm64, mips, powerpc, riscv, s390x etc do not have this problem and build just fine.

I talked with the Debian porters for the ARM platform and was told that the problem should only happen on platforms without native atomics, so maybe the problem also happens on parisc or sh.

> And only for gcc.

What makes you think that? When I build with clang, the error is still there but worded differently:

```
[ 65%] Linking CXX executable ../bin/vcmiserver
cd /<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/obj-arm-linux-gnueabi/server && /usr/bin/cmake -E cmake_link_script CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/link.txt --verbose=1
/usr/bin/clang++ -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -Wall -Wextra -Wpointer-arith -Wuninitialized -Wmismatched-tags -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-switch -Wno-reorder -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-varargs -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/StdInc.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CGameHandler.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/HeroPoolProcessor.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/PlayerMessageProcessor.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/ServerSpellCastEnvironment.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CQuery.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CVCMIServer.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksServer.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksLobbyServer.cpp.o -o ../bin/vcmiserver  -Wl,-rpath,"\$ORIGIN::::::::::::::::::::::::" ../bin/libvcmi.so /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libminizip.so /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libz.so -ldl -lrt /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_filesystem.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_program_options.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_locale.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_thread.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_atomic.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_chrono.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_system.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_date_time.so.1.74.0 
[...]
/usr/bin/arm-linux-gnueabi-ld: CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksLobbyServer.cpp.o:/usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueab
i/13/../../../../include/c++/13/ext/atomicity.h:66: more undefined references to `__atomic_fetch_add_4' follow
/usr/bin/arm-linux-gnueabi-ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_fetch_add_8'
/usr/bin/arm-linux-gnueabi-ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_load_8'
/usr/bin/arm-linux-gnueabi-ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_store_4'
/usr/bin/arm-linux-gnueabi-ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_compare_exchange_4'
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make[3]: *** [server/CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/build.make:273: bin/vcmiserver] Error 1
make[3]: Leaving directory '/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/obj-arm-linux-gnueabi'
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:574: server/CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/all] Error 2
```

> Judging from logs, we can check whether CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR is 'armv8l' and add -latomic when this is the case.

No, `CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR` is wrong for two reasons:

 - if i create a armel chroot on my arm64 system (similar to how amd64 can run i386, arm64 can run armel and armhf code), `CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR` will contain "arm64" but the problem when linking will still persist
 - `CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR` can be armv8l or armv7l but either values do not tell us whether the targeted abi is with or without hardfloat support, i.e whether it is armhf or armel, respectively

A better condition to check is `CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE`, I think, because it contains the abi name. Also, just to make sure that it is needed, cmake could compile a small test executable to assure that atomics support is indeed missing. I successfully tested the following patch for the Debian package:

https://salsa.debian.org/games-team/vcmi/-/blob/8e0cb72b180ba8070f77af2af19eda2d80832f78/debian/patches/fix-armel-atomics.patch

Let me paste it here just to make sure:

```patch
--- a/server/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/server/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -44,6 +44,21 @@ if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME MATCHES FreeBSD OR
 endif()
 target_link_libraries(vcmiserver PRIVATE ${server_LIBS} minizip::minizip)
 
+# link with -latomic if necessary
+# on armel the build will otherwise fail with
+# /usr/bin/ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_fetch_add_8'
+# /usr/bin/ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_load_8'
+if(CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE STREQUAL "arm-linux-gnueabi")
+	file(WRITE ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/test_atomics.cpp
+	"#include <stdint.h>\nint main(void){uint64_t x=0,y=0;return (int)__atomic_fetch_add_8(&x,y,0);}\n")
+	try_compile(ATOMICS_BUILD_SUCCEEDED ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR} ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/test_atomics.cpp)
+	message(STATUS "Found __sync_add_and_fetch_8(): ${ATOMICS_BUILD_SUCCEEDED}")
+	if (NOT ATOMICS_BUILD_SUCCEEDED)
+		target_link_options(vcmiserver PRIVATE "-Wl,--push-state,--no-as-needed,-latomic,--pop-state")
+	endif ()
+	file(REMOVE ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/test_atomics.cpp)
+endif()
+
 target_include_directories(vcmiserver
 	PUBLIC ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}
 )
```

With that patch applied, vcmi builds fine on armel: https://buildd.debian.org/status/package.php?p=vcmi

issue.title: In battle ranged units move 1 tile before hitting in mele
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
In battle ranged units move 1 tile before hitting in mele



**Expected behavior**
Ranged units should stay put before hitting.

**Actual behavior**
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15194321/225360280-95fa5b4c-7d98-4764-be81-7c4bcf3def10.mp4

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15194321/225361111-3f596ad4-2344-4958-a4ff-134e1ff98219.png)


**Version**
 - OS: Windows
 - Version: develop

comment.body:
> At least can we agree that this 1 hex moving is stupid? :)

Actually not. You need to prove it somehow affects gameplay in a bad way. Otherwise it just looks a bit strange for human but may have no effect on actual battle result. But even if you find any bad effect this will lead to an additional complexity for battle AI because we will have to analyze this effect. For instance we can check what enemy stacks can reach us on each possible attack hex and select one where it will be less enemies. O less free cells around or whatever else.

issue.title: Battle ai movement fix
issue.body:
A lot of debugging showed some bugs and flaws in initial design. Should be a bit better now.
AI should see strong stacks (archers) even if guarded by weak stacks (1-units).
AI prefers more slower targets comparing to own stack speed even if they are not reachable this turn. Still it is not hardcoded behavior.

comment.body: It just does not care if it needs to move or not. Selects first attack evaluated is one with smallest hex. Likely because score sort is stable and thus lower hex numbers go always first.

> Yes, I think one can only suggest changing a single line at once.

No. You actually can "suggest" multiple lines, by dragging that "+" symbol:
![зображення](https://github.com/vcmi/vcmi/assets/1576820/3d076ae5-4d3e-4c9c-afc6-23f14a4a1dbb)

pull_request.title: Mod compatibility fixes
pull_request.body:
Minor fixes to avoid potential crashes if player has outdated mods:
- Do not crash if handler for map objects was not found, instead fall back onto generic (empty) handler. Discovered since I removed separate "shrine" handler (merged into "configurable"), but hota mod uses "shrine" handler in 1.3.
- Block loading of objects into another mod namespace. Side effect of "torosar " fix - mods that still edit "torosar " now attempt to create new object with mostly invalid/unset properties.

repo.name: vcmi
repo.description: Open-source engine for Heroes of Might and Magic III

issue.title: fails to build on armel with undefined reference to `__atomic_fetch_add_8'
issue.body:
When compiling latest vcmi under Debian stable on armel it fails with:

```
[ 65%] Linking CXX executable ../bin/vcmiserver
cd /<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/obj-arm-linux-gnueabi/server && /usr/bin/cmake -E cmake_link_script CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/link.txt --verbose=1
/usr/bin/c++ -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -Wall -Wextra -Wpointer-arith -Wuninitialized -Wmismatched-tags -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-switch -Wno-reorder -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-varargs -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/StdInc.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CGameHandler.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/HeroPoolProcessor.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/PlayerMessageProcessor.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/ServerSpellCastEnvironment.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CQuery.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/CVCMIServer.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksServer.cpp.o CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/NetPacksLobbyServer.cpp.o -o ../bin/vcmiserver  -Wl,-rpath,"\$ORIGIN::::::::::::::::::::::::" ../bin/libvcmi.so /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libminizip.so /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libz.so -ldl -lrt /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_filesystem.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_program_options.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_locale.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_thread.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_atomic.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_chrono.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_system.so.1.74.0 /usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabi/libboost_date_time.so.1.74.0 
/usr/bin/ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_fetch_add_8'
/usr/bin/ld: ../bin/libvcmi.so: undefined reference to `__atomic_load_8'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[3]: *** [server/CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/build.make:273: bin/vcmiserver] Error 1
make[3]: Leaving directory '/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/obj-arm-linux-gnueabi'
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:574: server/CMakeFiles/vcmiserver.dir/all] Error 2
```

Full log: https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=vcmi&arch=armel&ver=1.3.2%2Bdfsg-1&stamp=1698162756&raw=0

This problem can be solved by adding the `-latomic` linker flag.

comment.body:
> This problem can be solved by adding the -latomic linker flag.

Looks like we need to add this *only* on such platforms? And only for gcc.

Judging from logs, we can check whether CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR is 'armv8l' and add -latomic when this is the case.
